ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Greater understanding of how to really dissect journal articles and understanding of different components of the cytoskeleton and how they are implicated in various diseases.
Reading scientific papers about the cytoskeleton and other proteins

The most helpful skill I learned by taking this course was how to read journal articles. Before taking this class, I had trouble getting through scientific articles due to scientific jargon and lack of knowledge regarding common methods used for experimentation.  However, the structure of the class really catered to these weaknesses as each week, students would provide a brief presentation on the background and methods discussed in the assigned paper.
Reading primary literature articles, understanding different scientific methods
I became much better at reading and understanding scientific literature.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the material is interesting and manageable, you get into it what you put in. Assignments are all reasonable. Dean C. is lovely.
Weaknesses: Class can get repetitive, but if you take the time to really read the papers, it is worth it!
This learning environment was comfortable and I felt like I could freely speak and discuss science!

This was a great senior seminar class! It was nice to be able to come to class each week and discuss the papers without having to study or retain as much info as you usually would with any other MCDB class. It makes you enjoy coming to class to just learn, which I think is a really nice way to spend a semester of your MCDB senior year, especially with Dean C!
This is already a wonderful course. You learn a lot in a stress free environment.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 1000x Yes. Incredible opportunity to explore variety of topics, model organisms, etc... that in some way relate to the cytoskeleton. Incredible professor that enables engagement and comprehension of material
Yes, I would certainly recommend this course as you get to really understand how to read difficult scientific papers. Discussion in class is very engaging and it is just an amazing experience.
Great way to fulfill your MCDB Senior requirement!
Yes! This is a great MCDB seminar!

Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone who has taken the necessary pre-requisites for the class. Scientific reading is an invaluable skill, especially for those who plan on pursuing research or medicine.
Yes! Great senior seminar to fulfill the major requirements
